name: electrocautery
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of cauterizing body tissue (= burning it to stop bleeding or infection, or to remove harmful cells) using a special needle that is heated by an electric current: Surgeons will usually use electrocautery during surgery to cut tissue or seal up blood vessels. Use of electrocautery should be avoided during deep dissection. Sometimes skin tags can bleed extensively when removed, requiring electrocauterization.
More examplesFewer examplesThe doctor may then cauterize the bleeding site with electrocautery.An incision is made through the fat using electrocautery.We stopped the haemorrhage using electrocautery under local anaesthesia. Electrocautery or electrocauterization is a widely used technique in modern surgery.The heat produced by an electrocautery needle destroys residual tumour and controls bleeding.
